title: Relates to personal care trend language incorporated into chapter 53 of the laws of 1990
summary: Relates to personal care trend language and the medicaid reimbursement rate paid to personal care providers incorporated into chapter 53 of the laws of 1990.

       AN  ACT  to amend chapter 53 of the laws of 1990 constituting the aid to
         localities budget, in relation to the personal care trend language

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Legislative intent and declaration. The legislature hereby
    2  finds and declares that a medicaid rate setting methodology for personal
    3  care services, entitled "Personal Care Trend Language", was incorporated
    4  in chapter 53 of the laws of 1990. The legislature further declares that
    5  its intention in adopting the subject provisions of chapter  53  of  the
    6  laws  of  1990  was  to  correct inadequacies and inconsistencies in the
    7  amount of medicaid reimbursement paid to personal care providers  across
    8  the  state  by  mandating  a  more  consistent  and  equitable  medicaid
    9  reimbursement rate, ensuring thereby that personal care providers  would
   10  be able and available to provide services to medically indigent elderly,
   11  disabled, ill and infirm individuals.
   12    The  legislature  further  finds  that, since their adoption, medicaid
   13  personal care rate setting provisions of chapter 53 of the laws of  1990
   14  have  from time to time been construed by public officials and agencies,
   15  and in courts, in a manner inconsistent with the legislature's intent in
   16  respect of those provisions, the public policy of the state, the  finan-
   17  cial  viability of the personal care program and access by the public to
   18  personal care services upon which thousands  of  the  state's  citizenry
   19  rely.  Therefore,  the  legislature hereby finds and declares that it is
   20  necessary to amend the subject provisions of chapter 53 of the  laws  of
   21  1990 to clarify the legislature's intent in adopting the same.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    1    S 2.  That part of section 1 of chapter 53 of the laws of 1990 consti-
    2  tuting  the  aid  to  localities  budget  making an appropriation to the
    3  department of social services for  the  medical  assistance  program  is
    4  amended to read as follows:

    5                        DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES

    6                                  SCHEDULE

    7  MEDICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM

    8    General Fund - Local Assistance Account

    9          PERSONAL CARE TREND LANGUAGE

   10  Notwithstanding  any  inconsistent provision
   11    of law or regulation to the contrary,  for
   12    services provided by personal care provid-
   13    ers  for  the rate or contract year begin-
   14    ning on or after July  1,  1990,  payments
   15    will  be  based upon reimbursement rate in
   16    effect for rate or contract  years  begin-
   17    ning prior to July 1, 1990 and adjusted by
   18    a trend factor. This trend factor, subject
   19    to approval by the director of the budget,
   20    shall  be  developed  in  accordance  with
   21    regulations promulgated by the  department
   22    of   social  services  and  shall  reflect
   23    appropriate external price indicators  for
   24    three  major components which comprise the
   25    cost of personal care: aide wage and bene-
   26    fit;  administrative  and  operating;  and
   27    clinical;   provided   however   that  the
   28    department  of   social   services   shall
   29    provide  public  notice  of  the  criteria
   30    utilized in calculating the trend  factor;
   31    and  provided  further,  however, that the
   32    department  of  social  services  and  the
   33    director  of  the budget shall, within two
   34    months  of  receipt  of  a  rate  request,
   35    review  and  approve rates which are based
   36    on  the  trend  factor  determinants   and
   37    established  at  or  below  the  mandatory
   38    trend factor; and provided further, howev-
   39    er, that exceptions to  the  trend  factor
   40    shall  be considered and acted upon by the
   41    department  of  social  services  and  the
   42    division  of the budget within four months
   43    from receipt,  for  extraordinary  circum-
   44    stances,  such as the inability to provide
   45    adequate personal care services, a diminu-
   46    tion in the quality of services  and  such
   47    other factors as defined by the department
   48    in consultation with personal care provid-
   49    ers  and  local districts.   Additionally,
   50    the  department  of  social  services,  in

    1    consultation with personal care providers,
    2    local  departments  of social services and

    4    advises  the department of health concern-

    8    the criteria for the  establishment  of  a
    9    rate setting methodology for personal care
   10    which  shall  at  a  minimum consider: (a)
   11    changes in the cost of living; (b)  appli-

   13    in federal department of labor, bureau  of
   14    labor   statistics;   (d)  administration,
   15    operation and clinical  factors;  (e)  the
   16    cost  of  training  personal care workers;
   17    [and] (f) the development of a  rate  year

   19    care providers; AND (G) THE RATES  CHARGED
   20    BY  PERSONAL  CARE  PROVIDERS TO UNINSURED
   21    PERSONS  TO   WHOM   SUCH   SERVICES   ARE
   22    PROVIDED;  PROVIDED  HOWEVER,  THAT  IN NO
   23    EVENT SHALL A RATE  OR  RATES  CHARGED  TO
   24    UNINSURED   RECIPIENTS  OF  PERSONAL  CARE
   25    SERVICES OR ANY AVERAGE OF OR OTHER CALCU-
   26    LATION BASED UPON SUCH RATE  OR  RATES  BE

   28    PURPOSES    OF    ESTABLISHING    PROVIDER
   29    REIMBURSEMENT  RATES  FOR  PERSONAL   CARE
   30    SERVICES  RENDERED TO PERSONS ELIGIBLE FOR
   31    MEDICAL ASSISTANCE. Such plan  shall  also
   32    consider   a   method,  developed  by  the
   33    department of health in consultation  with
   34    the  department  of  social  services  and
   35    representatives of the home care industry,
   36    by  which  the  methodology  used  by  the
   37    department  of  health  to establish rates
   38    for certified home health  agencies,  long
   39    term  home  health  care  programs and the
   40    AIDS home care programs shall consider  in
   41    the  establishment  of  such  rates, rates
   42    approved  by  the  department  of   social
   43    services  and  the  division of the budget
   44    for  personal  care  in  order  to  assure
   45    adequate  reimbursement  for aide services
   46    provided by certified  home  health  agen-
   47    cies,  long term home health care programs
   48    and AIDS home care programs -- less ....... (10,000,000)

   49    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
